markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

star-telegram.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of the Fort Worth Star-Telegram, a Pulitzer Prize-winning daily newspaper covering the Dallas-Fort Worth area of Texas.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The McClatchy Company, a publicly traded publishing firm, acquired the Star-Telegram and its website in 2006 when it purchased the newspaper’s parent company, Knight Ridder, Inc. The site earns revenue from advertising and subscriptions.

Content

The Star-Telegram provides local and national news, sports, business, and opinion sections. Wire services including The Associated Press and The Washington Post News Service provide coverage of national and international news. The sports section covers professional, collegiate, and high school teams in Texas. The Star-Telegram offers several editions that cover individual towns within the Dallas-Fort Worth area. A Spanish-language edition is also available on the website.

Credibility

Staff reporters, including a digital reporter and editor, create content for Star-Telegram.com. Headlines on the site are fair, balanced, and accurately reflect information in stories. Although the website does not have a visible corrections policy, corrections are regularly made in stories.

The Star-Telegram over the years has won several prestigious awards for journalism. In 1981, a photographer at the newspaper won a Pulitzer Prize for his photos of Liberian officials being executed by firing squad. In 1985, The Star-Telegram won a Pulitzer Prize in the Public Service category for an investigative story that revealed a design flaw in Bell Helicopters. Star-Telegram’s reporting found that the flaw had caused the deaths of 250 U.S. servicemen. The story ultimately led the Army to ground hundreds of helicopters.

Transparency

Advertising is distinguished from editorial content. After a previous version of this Nutrition Label was published, McClatchy sites, including Star-Telegram.com, began labeling articles from content recommendation firm ZergNet with the heading “FROM OUR ADVERTISING PARTNERS."

History

The Star-Telegram was founded in 1906 as the Fort Worth Star. In 1982, the newspaper published one of the country’s first electronic newspapers, StarText, which could be read on a computer. The website was registered in 1996.

Editor's Note: This Nutrition Label has been updated, and its rating has changed, after McClatchy sites began labeling paid content hosted by content recommendation firm ZergNet. The site now meets NewsGuard’s standard for labeling advertising.

Written by:
Evan Haddad
